title: Pitchfork Logo Font
content:
I searched and I don't think this has been ID'd yet. The Pitchfork (pitchfork.com) logo typeface.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen shot 2009-10-04 at 6.28.08 PM.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150408010058/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202009-10-04%20at%206.28.08%20PM.jpg) | 16.93 KB |
author: Kringdon5

comments.content: I think it's [Clarendon Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150408010058/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/clarendon-text/regular/), perhaps artificially bolded a bit. Note the somewhat unusual 't' for a font in this family.
Too many differences here to assume they modified any existing Clarendon. I'll bet it was drawn from scratch.
There was once a write-up about the pitchfork logo over at Brand New.. I'll see if I can find that bit later for you guys.
